arm_group.description: In this group of patients thoracic paravertebral block is performed.
In this group of patients general anesthesia is performed.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpouse of the study is to determine wether Ultrasound Guided,Ens-assisted
      paravertebral block with single shot is a safe and reliable anesthetic technique in breast
      surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Paravertebral Block in Breast Surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
General anaesthesia is currently the conventional technique used for breast surgery.
      Thoracic Paravertebral block (PVB) has been used with multiple injection.

      We compared a single  injection thoracic PVB with general anaesthesia (GA) in 20 consenting
      patients, scheduled for unilateral breast surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  American Society of Anesthesiologists classification I-III

          -  Written informed consent

          -  Age older than 18 years old

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  allergy to local anesthetics

          -  local sepsis

study_pop.textblock: Patient candidate for minor breast surgery.

clinical_study.official_title: Single Injection, Ultrasound Guided Paravertebral Block for Anesthesia in Breast Surgery.

other_outcome.description: We register the incidence of nausea and vomit in the post-perative time.
We administer an assessment questionnaire to patients to evaluate the appreciation of the anesthesiologic technique

oversight_info.authority: Italy: National Monitoring Centre for Clinical Trials - Ministry of Health

primary_outcome.description: The anesthesist evaluated the post-operative pain at rest and in movement with the NRS at 3-6-12-24 hours.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: We register the consumption of analgesic drugs in both groups in the post-operative period till 24 hours.
We evaluate efficacy and extension of the block with ice test and pin-prick test
